review: Surprise, surprise. I ended up in the Fire revolution. I bought this device to test its suitability in higher education for providing a mirroring platform for Android devices. iOS is covered with Apple TV and AirServer and their protocols, Android - not so much. Chromecast was of course option #1 but I chose to wait, the Roku stick followed then the Fire TV stick. Android has failed to mirror correctly on most of the devices I tested but I'll dedicate this review to my pleasant surprise... as a media device this rocks.I'll still use my PS3 and Playstation Media Server to stream local content from my desktop to my TV but this has pretty much replaced my need for cable. I mostly watch ESPN and CNN with a dash of some other stuff... It doesn't have a CNN live streaming app... but I sure hope it gets one. The HD is clear, buffering is minimal so their codecs are fine (20MB down, 2MB up) and its an all round decent device ESPECIALLY IF YOU'RE A PRIME CUSTOMER.
